author: David Maddock
title: Liverpool cannot afford to drop any more points in top 4 race warns Jurgen Klopp before Chelsea clash
text:
Sport Liverpool cannot afford to drop any more points in top 4 race warns Jurgen Klopp before Chelsea clash Reds boss wants victory over the leaders to start rebuilding belief at Anfield following a dismal start to 2017 Share Liverpool can cut the gap between them and Chelsea to seven points with a win (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Share Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jurgen Klopp is ready to “make the title race more exciting” by halting runaway leaders Chelsea . 
And the Liverpool manager explained that belief is the key to lifting a team that has seen their quest for honours seriously – if not fatally – undermined by three devastating Anfield defeats in the last week. 
The German coach knows that even if his side does defeat the Premier League leaders in an emotional game it may not deliver the title... but he does think it could open the race to the other sides at the top, such as Arsenal and Spurs. 
Victory over the visiting Blues on Tuesday would narrow the gap at the top, and he said: “If we are seven behind Chelsea we cannot say, 'Now we go for them!' They might win the rest of the games! Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jurgen Klopp speaks ahead of Chelsea Share this video Watch Next 
“If (Chelsea) is seven ahead of us then it will be five to Arsenal or whoever. That gap would obviously make the league that little bit more exciting for a lot of people. 
“But we need the points. That’s it. We cannot waste time or points any more. 
"We never wanted to. It’s not to say we can’t catch them. But that means nothing. We want to go for these three points and that’s enough to be motivated at the highest, highest level.” 
Despite the setbacks which saw Liverpool crash out of two cups in a week, Klopp insisted that he retains belief in his side, because he has seen the quality they possess. 
Liverpool have won just once in January, but in the season he left Dortmund, his side won just once in the December AND January then went on to win every game in February. 
He explained that belief is the key. Liverpool have been dropping points in the league while going out of both Cups (Photo: Getty) Read More The big debate: Does a top four finish this season represent success for Liverpool? 
“What is very important even in situations like this, is if you are convinced about your players – stay cool, the things will change,” he added. “It’s about seeing it, working on it and getting better, because you have to use the bad moments to prepare for the good moments. Even when you have too many bad moments. 
“I 100 per cent believe it makes you more of a winner if you are looking forward to winning and not worrying about losing. We can win the next game. 
“I love working with the players even when it is difficult because part of this game, even though nobody around Liverpool wants to hear it, is losing. If you lose you cannot stop. You have to go for the next game.” 
Klopp revealed he will wait until the afternoon of the game before deciding if Sadio Mane will play, after the club’s plans to fly him back early from the Africa Cup of Nations were scuppered. Mane has gone out of THREE Cups in the past week, if you include Senegal (Photo: AFP) Read More STAN COLLYMORE: Liverpool don't have the energy or squad to win this title — even if they beat Chelsea 
“We were prepared to collect him with the plane in Gabon, but it was not allowed to leave so he had to go with the (Senegal) team. 
“That meant another night in a hotel, but he will be back in training in the morning, and we will have to make a decision - look into his eyes and see what is possible with him, and make a decision.” poll loading
